Docs.summary: A that is composed of other dialogs.
Docs.remarks: A component dialog has an inner and , which provides an inner dialog stack that is hidden from the parent dialog.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogTurnResult> ContinueDialogAsync(class Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogContext outerDc, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

override this.ContinueDialogAsync : Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogContext * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogTurnResult>

Docs.param: The parent for the current turn of conversation.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
Docs.summary: Called when the dialog is _continued_, where it is the active dialog and the user replies with a new activity.
Docs.remarks:
If the task is successful, the result indicates whether the dialog is still active after the turn has been processed by the dialog. The result may also contain a return value.
If this method is *not* overridden, the component dialog calls the method on its inner dialog context. If the inner dialog stack is empty, the component dialog ends, and if a is available, the component dialog uses that as its return value.

abstract member EndComponentAsync : Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogContext * obj * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogTurnResult> override this.EndComponentAsync : Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogContext * obj * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogTurnResult>

Docs.param: The parent for the current turn of conversation.
Optional, value to return from the dialog component to the parent context.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
Docs.summary: Ends the component dialog in its parent's context.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks:
If the task is successful, the result indicates that the dialog ended after the turn was processed by the dialog.
In general, the parent context is the dialog or bot turn handler that started the dialog. If the parent is a dialog, the stack calls the parent's
method to return a result to the parent dialog. If the parent dialog does not implement `ResumeDialogAsync`, then the parent will end, too, and the result is passed to the next parent context, if one exists.
The returned contains the return value in its property.

Reason why the dialog ended.

Docs.summary: Called when the dialog is ending.
Docs.remarks: When this method is called from the parent dialog's context, the component dialog cancels all of the dialogs on its inner dialog stack before ending.

Docs.summary: Called when the dialog is started and pushed onto the parent's dialog stack.

If the task is successful, the result indicates whether the dialog is still active after the turn has been processed by the dialog.
By default, this calls the method of the component dialog's initial dialog, as defined by .
Override this method in a derived class to implement interrupt logic.

If the task is successful, the result indicates whether the dialog is still active after the turn has been processed by the dialog. The result may also contain a return value.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogTurnResult> ResumeDialogAsync(class Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogContext outerDc, valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogReason reason, object result, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Public Overrides Function ResumeDialogAsync (outerDc As DialogContext, reason As DialogReason, Optional result As Object = null, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = null) As Task(Of DialogTurnResult)

override this.ResumeDialogAsync : Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogContext * Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogReason * obj * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.DialogTurnResult>

Docs.param: The for the current turn of conversation.
Reason why the dialog resumed.
Optional, value returned from the dialog that was called. The type of the value returned is dependent on the child dialog.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
Docs.summary: Called when a child dialog on the parent's dialog stack completed this turn, returning control to this dialog component.
Docs.remarks:
If the task is successful, the result indicates whether this dialog is still active after this dialog turn has been processed.
Generally, the child dialog was started with a call to in the parent's context. However, if the method is called, the logical child dialog may be different than the original.
If this method is *not* overridden, the dialog automatically calls its when the user replies.
